title: Sustainable Dairy Cropping Systems: The Virtual Dairy Herd

tasks.task: Attend an agricultural presentation on sustainable dairy cropping systems.
subtasks: Listen to Jenny Isler from Penn State discuss the virtual dairy farm project.
Learn about the project's interdisciplinary approach involving multiple faculty and staff.
Understand the two cropping approaches being compared: best management practice (BMP) and best management practice enhanced (BMP+).
Recognize the use of cover crops, green manure, alfalfa, and canola in the cropping systems.
Analyze the impact of alternative forages and small grains on feed inventory.
Evaluate the role of canola for both feed and fuel in the BMP+ scenario.
Examine the effects of reduced versus standard herbicide use in cropping systems.
Consider the implications of manure injection versus broadcast application on farm management.
Assess the economic outcomes of the BMP and BMP+ scenarios, including income over feed costs.
Compare the performance of the BMP and BMP+ scenarios during drought and varied weather conditions.
Evaluate the role of crop yields and forage quality in the economic analysis.
Understand the significance of flexible forage management in应对气候变i的挑战。
Recognize the importance of sustainable practices in maintaining profitability over time.
Learn about the potential benefits of vegetable oil as a fuel source and canola meal in feeding dairy herds.
Consider the scalability of the project's findings for farms with limited land resources.
